app.title: Arabic Kids • Shibl
app.tagline: Playful Arabic practice with a non-verbal companion
app.subheading: Short, guided activities keep learners focused. Shibl reacts with simple animations only—no chat, no accounts, and all progress stays on this device.

lesson.safetyNote: Shibl reacts visually to lesson events only. No chat or free text is collected.

feedback.lessonComplete: Lesson complete! Get ready for the next step.

lesson.completedStatus: You finished this lesson. Continue when you’re ready.
lesson.reviewSummaryBody: Quick check-in before you move on. No answer needed.
lesson.unsupportedType: This step uses an unsupported format. We skipped it so you can keep going.

level.startCopy: Begin Level {level}. Progress stays on this device.
level.lockedCopy: Finish Level {previous} to unlock this one.
level.completedStatus: Level completed! You can replay lessons anytime.
level.completedBody: Great work finishing Level {level}. You can replay lessons anytime.

auth.parentLoginDesc: Parents sign in here. Children keep learning without typing passwords.
auth.parentRegisterDesc: Create a parent-only account to manage access. Children never need credentials.
auth.emailAlreadyUsed: This email already has an account.
auth.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters.
auth.passwordTooLong: Password must be 72 characters or fewer.
auth.loggingOut: Signing you out of your parent session...

account.placeholder: Parents manage access here. Children keep playing lessons without logging in.
account.dataNotice: Progress stays on this device. Only your email and hashed password are stored for parent sign-in.
account.noProgress: Progress will appear after your child starts Level 1.

assessments.entryBody: Quick, pressure-free checks for letters, words, sentences, and paragraphs. Unlimited retries.
assessments.title: Check your reading
assessments.lede: Choose a calm assessment to see how reading feels today. No grades, no locks—just gentle feedback.
assessments.safety: No timers or scores. You can retry anytime.
assessments.resultsBody: Saved locally as a snapshot for parents. No history or timestamps stored.
assessments.chooseTypeBody: Select what you want to check right now. You can switch anytime.
assessments.tryUntilReady: Try again until it feels right.
assessments.readyToStart: Press start to begin this assessment.
assessments.noteBody: We do not lock content or track attempts. Each try overwrites the previous summary only.

feedback.incorrect: Try again; you can retry as much as you like.

stories.entryBody: Gentle, optional Arabic stories to practice after assessments. Large text, calm pacing, replay anytime.
stories.title: Short Stories
stories.lede: Read very short Arabic paragraphs built from Level 11–20 vocabulary. No scores—just quiet reading.
stories.safety: Stories are optional and do not change lesson or assessment progress.
stories.listBody: Each story has three short paragraphs. Replay freely and listen if you like.
stories.readerLede: Read one paragraph at a time. Use next or previous when you are ready.
stories.listenUnavailable: Listening is not available on this device.
stories.listenOptional: Listening is optional—read at your own pace.

exams.entryBody: Calm practice exams based on completed learning. No pressure, no grades—just validation and parent-friendly reports.
exams.title: Practice Exams
exams.lede: Choose a calm practice exam to validate learning. No timers, no scores—just gentle feedback and insights for parents.
exams.safety: No timers, no scores, no pass/fail. You can retry anytime.
exams.parentReportBody: Clear insights about what your child can do and what to practice next. Saved locally as a snapshot.
exams.chooseTypeBody: Select what you want to validate right now. You can switch anytime.
exams.tryUntilReady: Try again until it feels right.
exams.readyToStart: Press start to begin this exam.
exams.noteBody: This is a practice exam, separate from lessons and assessments. It does not affect progression or unlock content. Results show qualitative feedback only.

feedback.incorrect: Try again; you can retry as much as you like.

letters.strong: Your child can identify letters by sound and discriminate similar letters confidently.
letters.good: Your child recognizes most letters and can build simple words with some support.
letters.needsPractice: Your child is learning to identify letters. More practice with letter sounds will help.

words.strong: Your child reads words fluently and understands their meanings.
words.good: Your child can read familiar words and understands most meanings.
words.needsPractice: Your child is building word recognition. Regular reading practice will strengthen this.

sentences.strong: Your child reads sentences fluently and grasps their meaning clearly.
sentences.good: Your child understands most sentences and can identify main ideas.
sentences.needsPractice: Your child is developing sentence comprehension. Reading simple sentences together will help.

paragraphs.strong: Your child reads paragraphs confidently and identifies main ideas and details.
paragraphs.good: Your child understands paragraphs and can find key information with some guidance.
paragraphs.needsPractice: Your child is learning to read longer texts. Start with short paragraphs and discuss them together.

letters.strong: Keep reinforcing letter sounds through word building activities.
letters.good: Practice discriminating similar letters and building more complex words.
letters.needsPractice: Focus on letter sounds and matching them to written letters. Use repetition and encouragement.

words.strong: Move to more complex words and sentence reading.
words.good: Practice reading words in context and exploring new vocabulary.
words.needsPractice: Review familiar words daily and connect them to pictures or real objects.

sentences.strong: Encourage reading longer texts and discussing main ideas.
sentences.good: Practice identifying sentence topics and discussing what was read.
sentences.needsPractice: Read simple sentences together and ask 'what happened?' questions.

paragraphs.strong: Explore more complex texts and discuss themes and details.
paragraphs.good: Practice finding main ideas and supporting details in short texts.
paragraphs.needsPractice: Read one paragraph at a time, then talk about what it says. Use the stories feature.

finalExam.entryBody: One calm readiness check after Levels 1–20. Unlimited retries, no grades.
finalExam.title: Final checkpoint exam
finalExam.lede: Validate Arabic reading readiness after Levels 1–20. Sections cover letters, words, sentences, and a paragraph.
finalExam.objective: Objective: a calm readiness check across four sections without grades.
finalExam.safety: No scores, no timers, no pass/fail. Arabic appears only inside activities.
finalExam.readinessBody: Complete all four sections once, then review the qualitative report.
finalExam.localOnly: Latest result saved on this device only
finalExam.resultBody: Qualitative ratings only: strong, good, or needs practice for each section.
finalExam.structureBody: Four calm sections in order. Each section uses existing activity types.
finalExam.retries: Unlimited retries. Each attempt overwrites the previous snapshot.
finalExam.readyToStart: Press start to begin the final checkpoint.
finalExam.noScores: No scores or percentages are shown.
finalExam.completed: Checkpoint completed. Review the report below.
finalExam.tryUntilReady: You can retry until it feels right.
finalExam.noteBody: This checkpoint does not affect level progression. It is a calm readiness check only.

feedback.incorrect: Try again; you can retry as much as you like.
